sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Richard Arlen, Fay Wray, William Powell, Clive Brook
Directors: Merian C. Cooper, Lothar Mendes, Ernest B. Schoedsack
Producer: David O. Selznick
Writer: A.E.W. Mason (based on a novel by)
üçïORIGINAL VITAPHONE SYNCRONIZED SCOREüçï
When a British officer resigns from his regiment on the news of his deployment in the Sudan, he receives four white feathers as a mark of his cowardice. In order to redeem himself, he sets out to return the feathers to the pockets they came from.

Today, it‚Äôs a sweeping silent-era production of A.E.W. Mason‚Äôs classic novel of cowardice, courage, and karma. Richard Arlen commands the screen as the man with nothing more to lose, while his friends of the feather are portrayed by William Powell, Clive Brook, Theodore von Eltz, and heartbreaker Fay Wray.

Directed by visionary filmmakers Merian C. Cooper, Lothar Mendes, and Ernest B. Schoedsack, and produced by the legendary David O. Selznick, this film showcases early Hollywood‚Äôs finest talents in one unforgettable cinematic experience. Witness a disgraced British officer's journey to prove his valor by returning the four white feathers he received‚Äîsymbols of his alleged cowardice‚Äîto the men who branded him.

metadata.Plot: When British officer Harry resigns from his regiment, he is labeled a coward by his family and friends. Harry receives four white feathers as a mark of a coward. In order to redeem himself and win the heart of his fianc√© back and the love of his best friend, Harry sets out to return the feathers to the pockets they came from.
